{"step_by_step_thinking": "Urea cycle disorders are a group of rare disorders affecting the urea cycle, a series of biochemical processes in which nitrogen is converted into urea and removed from the body. When the urea cycle is not working properly, ammonia can build up in the body, causing a variety of symptoms. Phenylbutyrate is a medication that is used to treat some urea cycle disorders. It helps the body get rid of extra nitrogen. Phenyl butarone is not a known drug. L-Carnitine is used for a variety of conditions, but not specifically for urea cycle disorders. Isoleucin is an essential amino acid, not a drug used to treat urea cycle disorders.", "answer_choice": "B. Phenyl butyrate"}
